LearnNonparam 1.1.7
  • Reference

    Two Sample Permutation Test Based on Correlation Coefficients

    Correlation.Rd

    Performs correlation coefficient based two sample permutation test on data vectors.

    Super classes

    LearnNonparam::Permutation Test -> LearnNonparam::Two Sample Permutation Test -> LearnNonparam::Paired Two Sample Permutation Test -> LearnNonparam::Two Sample Permutation Test for Association -> Two Sample Permutation Test (correlation coefficient)

    Methods

    Public methods

    • Correlation$new()

    Inherited methods
    • LearnNonparam::Permutation Test$feed()
    • LearnNonparam::Permutation Test$plot_hist()

    Method new()

    Create a new Correlation object.

    Usage

    Correlation$new(
  type = c("permu", "approx"),
  method = c("pearson", "kendall", "spearman"),
  alternative = c("two_sided", "less", "greater"),
  n_permu = NULL
)

    Arguments

    type

    a character string specifying the way to calculate p-values, must be one of "permu" (default) or "approx".

    method

    a character string indicating which correlation coefficient is to be computed. Must be one of "pearson" (default), "kendall", or "spearman".

    alternative

    a character string specifying the alternative hypothesis, must be one of "two_sided" (default), "greater" or "less".

    n_permu

    an integer specifying how many permutations should be used to construct the permutation distribution. If NULL (default) then all permutations are used.

    Returns

    A Correlation object.
